Text.Value: This is private property. You need to leave - or I'll make you.
There's no one here to throw you out - I don't see why you can't stay.
Off with you, then! We don't need an audience, that's for sure.
You should leave - there'll be trouble if you stay.
And you'd better be grateful for it.
...Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: With some difficulty due to being conflicted about accepting charity

Text.Value: I could not care less.
Thank you - and may Torm keep you.
More defensible, too...

EditorData.NodeContext: Contemplative; he clearly anticipates an attack

Text.Value: I spend most of my life hunting things that'd kill you as soon as they looked at you and you're telling me about 'trouble'?!
The selfish ponce who owns this place was trying to hire some gang to throw us out - but it looks like you got rid of them.
You're the first person in this city to have our backs. Thank you. Really.
Your word? Well... if you're sure. And you're definitely not pulling my leg...
Make it quick if you can - I don't like the way he's looking at us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still a little wary (but matter of fact)

Text.Value: You did your good deed, but Torm's still watching you - don't disappoint him now.
We will stay. For now. I just hope he doesn't pay anyone else to come sniffing round.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grateful - but also a little concerned

Text.Value: Look, this place doesn't belong to you - get out or I'll have to throw you out.
I'm trying to help you - I just need to talk to the man in charge.
But... you're right. I can't risk those people getting a hold of my daughter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Calming himself for the sake of his family; resignation and a tinge of sadness when speaking about the kids

Text.Value: We're much more interested in the beds and the pantry - but I'll make sure Cinta knows the basement's off-limits.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little worried - but glad for the warning

Text.Value: I don't want to take charity from some stranger. But... I will. For the sake of my daughter.
I don't know if it's your place to give us permission to stay here, but thank you. Really. My family needs this.
I'm trying to help you - wait here.
You are quite welcome.
You city thugs are all the same. I'll protect my family with my life if I have to!

EditorData.NodeContext: Desperate bravery; will do anything to protect his family

Text.Value: The poncy prat who owns this place is long gone - so I think we can both agree he doesn't need it anymore.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bit pleased about it
EditorData.logicalname: Crime solved (the player might not met them! might be in prison or dead!)

Text.Value: Not quite sure why you stood up for us like that, but I won't say I'm not grateful. Thanks. And may Torm keep you.
Who are you? Some thug here to do that stuffed shirt's dirty work?

EditorData.NodeContext: Wary; unsure of the player's intentions

Text.Value: What's the word? Can we stay?
I am. It's been days since my family slept under a roof - so thank you.
Same way lots of us did - trying to get away from the army of the Absolute.
Leave.
You're just as bad as the rest of them.
Leave.
Take this coin, find a safe-house in the city. You don't want mercenaries near your kids. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Here - take this. You'll be much better off in an inn than waiting to get chased out of here. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
You're seriously gonna throw us out? Throw my child out?
One thing: stay out of the basement. It's not safe.
Back again, are you? What do you want with us now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly wary (not sure of the player's intentions)

Text.Value: How did you end up here?
Stay? What are you talking about?
What exactly is going on here?
I understand. Let me talk to the owner of this place - maybe I can help.
If you had the chance to put a roof over your family's heads after being on the run for Torm knows how long, wouldn't you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Matter of fact; expects the player to see where he's coming from

Text.Value: Oh. Well. Thank you. I think?

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat confused; wasn't expecting to be told they could stay

Text.Value: No one's telling you to leave - have all the roof you want.
I'm not interested in sob stories.
Don't worry - we'll go. May Torm split open that hard, blackened heart of yours some day.
I don't like being cooped up inside, but it's what's best for Cinta - I'll make sure she knows you had a hand in it.
I see those animals are out of the picture - can we stay now, or are you going to turn on us next?
We'll get going as soon as we've got our things together.
I heard you talking about us - you gonna kick my little girl out onto the streets, are you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry; worried about his family and defensive of them

Text.Value: Thanks for your concern, but it'll be safer for my family to have four walls and a roof over their heads.
The owner won't mind if you stay - you have my word.

Synopsis: General dialog for the refugee leader - father of the refugee family who stayed in the merchant's house when he was away.
